actor_awards.notes: Best known for her role as Ethel Mertz in the landmark sitcom 'I Love Lucy', for which she became the first actress to win the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in 1954.She was a primary television star with limited feature film appearances.

filmography.title: The Great Race
filmography.role_description: The wife of a newspaper editor who is a suffragette and vocal advocate for women's rights.
filmography.plot: A professional daredevil and a villainous arch-rival race from New York to Paris in the early 20th century to promote automobile sales.

filmography.title: The Blue Veil
filmography.role_description: A supportive friend to the main character, a woman who dedicates her life to caring for children.
filmography.plot: After losing her own child, a widow devotes her life to being a nanny for other people's children, sacrificing her own happiness.

filmography.title: The Secret Fury
filmography.role_description: A streetwise chambermaid who interacts with the protagonist during her descent into a conspiracy.
filmography.plot: A woman about to be married is accused of already being married to another man, leading to a spiral of insanity and a mystery.

filmography.title: I Love Lucy
filmography.role_description: The loyal landlady and best friend to Lucy Ricardo, always getting roped into her schemes.
filmography.plot: A feature-length compilation of three episodes from the famous sitcom, edited together for a theatrical release that was shelved.

filmography.title: The Great Houdini
filmography.role_description: A nurse who attends to the legendary magician Harry Houdini. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A biographical film about the life and career of the famous escape artist Harry Houdini.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Achievement in Special Musical Material

filmography.title: The Front Page
filmography.role_description: The mother of the main character's fiancée in this television adaptation of the classic play. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor tricks his retiring star reporter into covering one last big story about an escaped convict.

filmography.title: Getting Away from It All
filmography.role_description: A woman involved in the sale of an island to two couples seeking a quiet life. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Two couples decide to leave the city and buy an island to escape the rat race, only to find it's not as peaceful as they hoped.

filmography.title: Lucy Calls the President
filmography.role_description: Lucy's neighbor and friend who gets involved when the President of the United States calls. (TV Special)
filmography.plot: Lucy Whittaker unexpectedly receives a telephone call from President Jimmy Carter.
